No secretary of state

And let me just

it begins to create doubts.

And doubts are poisonous for the
ability of a secretary of state
to be effective.

ERIN BURNETT: And
Tillerson hasn't

taken any questions on this
trip, as you know, Richard.

He doesn't have a deputy,
as you pointed out.

He hasn't had a press
conference since he took over.
How much time does he have?

He is someone that
does lend gravitas

and credibility,
world relationships
to the Trump administration.

But as you point out,
the runway is short.

RICHARD HAASS: Well, the
president has to empower
his secretary of state.

The president has to
go out there and show

that the secretary
of state speaks
for him, that the two of them--

there's no daylight
between them.

It would also help if there
was a national security adviser

in place in this,
because we don't really

have an administration to
speak of when you start talking
about national security.
So these are early days.
It's only-- what?

It's less than a month since
the administration began.

But they can't count on the
world remaining a calm place
or a relatively calm place.

Sooner or later, a real
crisis rather than one

generated by the
administration itself is going
to come into their inboxes.

And they had better be up
and running and ready for it.
